verses.verse: Now the word <S%H1697><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came unto Jonah <S%H3124><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Amittai <S%H573><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>,

Arise <S%H6965><s%>, go <S%H3212><s%> to Nineveh <S%H5210><s%>, that great <S%H1419><s%> city <S%H5892><s%>, and cry <S%H7121><s%> against it <S%H7451><s%>; for their wickedness is come up <S%H5927><s%> before me <S%H6440><s%>.

But Jonah <S%H3124><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%> to flee <S%H1272><s%> unto Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and went down <S%H3381><s%> to Joppa <S%H3305><s%>; and he found <S%H4672><s%> a boat <S%H591><s%> going <S%H935><s%> to Tarshish <S%H8659><s%>: so he paid <S%H5414><s%> the fare <S%H7939><s%> there <S%H3381><s%>, and went down into it <S%H935><s%>, to go with them unto Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.

But the Lord <S%H3068><s%> sent out <S%H2904><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> into the sea <S%H3220><s%>, and there was a mighty <S%H1419><s%> storm <S%H5591><s%> in the sea <S%H3220><s%>, so that the boat <S%H591><s%> was likely <S%H2803><s%> to be broken <S%H7665><s%>.

Then the mariners <S%H4419><s%> were afraid <S%H3372><s%>, and cried <S%H2199><s%> every man <S%H376><s%> unto his god <S%H430><s%>, and cast forth <S%H2904><s%> the wares <S%H3627><s%> that were in the boat <S%H591><s%> into the sea <S%H3220><s%>, to lighten <S%H7043><s%> it of them <S%H3124><s%>. But Jonah was gone down <S%H3381><s%> into the sides <S%H3411><s%> of the boat <S%H5600><s%>; and he lay <S%H7901><s%>, and was fast asleep <S%H7290><s%>.

So the shipmaster <S%H7227><s%> came <S%H7126><s%> to him <S%H559><s%>, and said unto him <S%H7290><s%>, What mean you, O sleeper? arise <S%H6965><s%>, call <S%H7121><s%> upon your God <S%H430><s%>, if so be that God <S%H430><s%> will think <S%H6245><s%> upon us <S%H6><s%>, that we perish not.

And they said <S%H559><s%> every one <S%H376><s%> to his fellow <S%H7453><s%>, Come <S%H3212><s%>, and let us cast <S%H5307><s%> lots <S%H1486><s%>, that we may know <S%H3045><s%> for whose cause <S%H7945><s%> this evil <S%H7451><s%> is upon us <S%H5307><s%>. So they cast lots <S%H1486><s%>, and the lot <S%H1486><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> upon Jonah <S%H3124><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> they unto him <S%H5046><s%>, Tell us <S%H7451><s%>, we pray you, for whose cause this evil is upon us <S%H4399><s%>; What is your occupation? and from where <S%H370><s%> come <S%H935><s%> you <S%H776><s%>? what is your country? and of what people are you <S%H5971><s%>?

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H5680><s%>, I am a Hebrew; and I fear <S%H3373><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of heaven <S%H8064><s%>, which has made <S%H6213><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> and the dry land <S%H3004><s%>.

Then were the men <S%H582><s%> exceedingly <S%H1419><s%> afraid <S%H3372><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H6213><s%>, Why have you done this <S%H582><s%>? For the men knew <S%H3045><s%> that he fled <S%H1272><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, because he had told them <S%H5046><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> they unto him <S%H6213><s%>, What shall we do unto you <S%H3220><s%>, that the sea may be calm <S%H8367><s%> unto us <S%H3220><s%>? for the sea done <S%H1980><s%>, and was tempestuous <S%H5590><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H5375><s%>, Take me up, and cast me forth <S%H2904><s%> into the sea <S%H3220><s%>; so shall the sea <S%H3220><s%> be calm <S%H8367><s%> unto you <S%H3045><s%>: for I know that for my sake <S%H7945><s%> this great <S%H1419><s%> storm is upon you <S%H5591><s%>.

Nevertheless the men <S%H582><s%> rowed hard <S%H2864><s%> to bring <S%H7725><s%> it to the land <S%H3004><s%>; but they could <S%H3201><s%> not <S%H3220><s%>: for the sea done <S%H1980><s%>, and was tempestuous against them <S%H5590><s%>.

Therefore they cried <S%H7121><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, We beg you <S%H577><s%>, O Lord <S%H3068><s%>, we beg you <S%H6><s%>, let us not perish for this man <S%H376><s%>'s life <S%H5315><s%>, and lay <S%H5414><s%> not upon us innocent <S%H5355><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%>: for you <S%H3068><s%>, O Lord, have done <S%H6213><s%> as it pleased you <S%H2654><s%>.
So they took up <S%H5375><s%> Jonah <S%H3124><s%>, and cast him forth <S%H2904><s%> into the sea <S%H3220><s%>: and the sea <S%H3220><s%> ceased <S%H5975><s%> from her raging <S%H2197><s%>.

Then the men <S%H582><s%> feared <S%H3372><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> exceedingly <S%H1419><s%>, and offered <S%H2076><s%> a sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and made <S%H5087><s%> vows <S%H5088><s%>.

Now the Lord <S%H3068><s%> had prepared <S%H4487><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> fish <S%H1709><s%> to swallow up <S%H1104><s%> Jonah <S%H3124><s%>. And Jonah <S%H3124><s%> was in the belly <S%H4578><s%> of the fish <S%H1709><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> and three <S%H7969><s%> nights <S%H3915><s%>.
